smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function resizeImage has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

The function addFromDbIfNeeded has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

The function setMediasPreview has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function getSearchData has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function sendTootIntent has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

smells.name: NotImplementedDeclaration
smells.description: The NotImplementedDeclaration should only be used when a method stub is necessary. This defers the development of the functionality of this function. Hence, the NotImplementedDeclaration should only serve as a temporary declaration. Before releasing, this type of declaration should be removed.

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class BoundedSpan defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class PatternFinder defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class MutableStringPair defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.description: Restrict the number of throw statements in methods.

instances.message: Too many throw statements in the function setupActivity. The maximum number of allowed throw statements is 2.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (ComposeActivity.MAXIMUM_URL_LENGTH * 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ComposeActivity.MAXIMUM_URL_LENGTH * 2
Parentheses in (character != '@' && character != '#' && character != ':') are unnecessary and can be replaced with: character != '@' && character != '#' && character != ':'
Parentheses in (i - fromIndex) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: i - fromIndex
Parentheses in (halfHeight / inSampleSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: halfHeight / inSampleSize
Parentheses in (halfWidth / inSampleSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: halfWidth / inSampleSize
Parentheses in (visibility != Visibility.DIRECT && visibility != Visibility.UNKNOWN) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: visibility != Visibility.DIRECT && visibility != Visibility.UNKNOWN
Parentheses in (directory.exists()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: directory.exists()
Parentheses in (activity as? BottomSheetActivity) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activity as? BottomSheetActivity
Parentheses in (R.color.tusky_blue) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: R.color.tusky_blue
Parentheses in (R.color.tusky_blue) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: R.color.tusky_blue

smells.description: Private member is unused.

instances.message: Private function getSuccessResponseCallbackWithMaximumTootCharacters is unused.
Private property isSwipeToRefreshEnabled is unused.
Function parameter msg is unused.
Function parameter msg is unused.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `newField.name.toRequestBody(MultipartBody.FORM) to newField.value.toRequestBody(MultipartBody.FORM)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `status to ViewDataUtils.statusToViewData(status, alwaysShowSensitiveMedia, alwaysOpenSpoiler)!!`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `status.first to StatusViewData.Builder(status.second).setIsExpanded(expanded).createStatusViewData()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `status.first to StatusViewData.Builder(status.second).setReblogged(reblog).createStatusViewData()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `status.first to StatusViewData.Builder(status.second).setIsShowingSensitiveContent(isShowing).createStatusViewData()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `status.first to StatusViewData.Builder(status.second).setCollapsed(collapsed).createStatusViewData()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `status.first to newViewData`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `status.first to StatusViewData.Builder(status.second).setFavourited(isFavorited).createStatusViewData()`

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions.
